title: Experienced "Tilt" for the first time last night.
body:
I was playing a game as {{champion:420}} top against a {{champion:45}} also in the top lane.  After just a few waves I had forced him out of lane twice I was up a level or two and I was up by a good amount of CS. Then randomly for the first time in over a year I got the dreaded "Attempting to reconnect" popup and the {{champion:45}} auto attacked me to death while I stood there motionless (according to my buddies on coms with me).

I reconnected a few minutes later. Behind him in CS, down a level and 1 kill behind. And honestly pretty dang annoyed. 

From there I died 5 more times, forgot to ward the river and misjudged his DMG time and again. 

This isnt to say I dont have games where I go 0/6 at the end of laning. But I am good about warding and when I am behind I rarely go for kills in lane unless I have help. 

I am usually good about "Its just a game" but I just kept taking it personally. Crazy how much tilt can impact your game.

replies.body: IMO it is much worse when it is a factor outside your own control, like networking or someone playing darius. Being helpless sucks.
As far as hovers go.... Darius never worried me..... There are others that I greatly fear more.... :)

Yeah, I have been playing a few years and even when other people feed my lane or something...it's just a game. But my network disconnecting and everything after just got to me.
You being human, that is normal, BUT get good at league you have to stop being human and turn into a machine that make only optimal decision no matter what.
